NetLive allows you to monitor your internet data transfer rate while also showing the app that is using the most data at the current moment. It runs both in the notification drawer or as a widget, so you always have access to your transfer rate information.
NetLive uses the official International System of Units (SI). This means, for example, that a kilobit is considered 1000 bits, not 1024 bits.
NetLive is now running in your notification drawer, welcome to the revolution!\n\n

The methods in the Android SDK which give you info on how much data an individual app is using, do not work in Android 4.3. If you have a 4.3 device, you can easily tell if it is working or not by enabling the active app feature, and then checking if an app title ever appears. If it does, that means it is working, if it simply shows this \"(…)\" all the time, then your device has the bug. These methods may work on some devices with Android 4.3, but they certainly do not work on the majority of 4.3 devices. I filed a bug report with the Android Open Source Project and it is a confirmed issue. You can view the bug report here: \n

The active app feature is no longer available on Android 7.0 and above due to changes in Android. The functionality that was provided by TrafficStats has been replaced by NetworkStatsManager. NetworkStatsManager does not update quickly enough to support the active app feature. NetworksStatsManager is meant to provide historical data, not moment to moment data. More info here: \n
